1802029 THE GOA, DAMAN AND DIU JUDICIAL COMMISSIONER' S COURT (DECLARATION AS HIGH COURT) ACT, 1964
ACT NO. 16 OF 1964 AN ACT TO DECLARE THE JUDICIAL COMMISSIONER' S COURT F OR GOA, DAMAN AND [ 16th May, 1964.]
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Fifteenth Year of the Republic of India as follows:-
1513338 1 Short title and commencement.
544264 1This Act may be called the Goa, Daman and Diu Judicial Commissioner' s Court (Declaration as High Court), Act, 1964.
1926616 2It shall be deemed to have come into force on the date of commencement of the Goa, Daman and Diu (Judicial Commissioner' s Court) Regulation, 1963. (10 of 1963)
247582 2Definition. In this Act," article" means an article of the Constitution.
1321769 3Declaration of Goa, Daman and Diu Judicial Commissioner' s Court as High Court for certain purposes. The Court of the Judicial Commissioner for the Union territory of Goa, Daman and Diu (hereinafter referred to, as the Judicial Commissioner' s Court) is hereby declared to be a High Court for the purposes of articles 132, 133 and 134.
1522781 4Appeals to the Supreme Court not to be barred on account of judgement etc., being of a single Judge. An appeal shall lie to the Supreme Court under the provisions of article 133 from any judgment, decree or final order of, the Judicial Commissioner' s Court notwithstanding that such judgment, decree or final order is that of a single Judge.
164799 5Appeals to Supreme Court from judgment, decree, etc., passed or made Judicial Commissioner' s court. Subject to any rules made under article 145 or any other law as to the time within which appeals to the Supreme Court are to be entered, an appeal shall lie to that Court from a judgment, decree or final order of the Judicial Commissioner' s Court, under the provisions of article 132 or article 133, or from a judgment, final order or sentence of such Court under the provisions of article 134:
130
Provided that an appeal may be preferred within ninety days from the date of passing of this Act from a judgment, decree, final order or sentence passed or made by the Judicial Commissioner' s Court before that date.
1793072 6 Exceptions and modifications subject to which the provisions of Chapter V of Part VI of the Constitution apply to the Judicial Commissioner' s court. The provisions of Chapter V of Part VI of the Constitution shall in their application to the Judicial Commissioner' s Court have effect subject to the following exceptions and modifications, namely:-
1496786 athe provisions of articles 216, 217, 218, 220, 221, 222, 223, 224, 224A, 225, 230 and 231 shall not apply;
1582253 breferences-
1591687 iin article 219, in the proviso to clause (3) of article 227 and in article 229 to the Governor shall be construed as references to the administrator of the Union territory of Goa, Daman and Diu;
894945 iiin articles 219 and 229 to the State (except in the expression" the State Public Service Commission") shall be construed as references to the Union territory of Goa, Daman and Diu;
1485197 cthe reference to the State Public Service Commission in the proviso to clause (1) of article 229 shall be construed as a reference to the Union Public Service Commission.
1392715 7 Appeals to lie to the Supreme Court from judgment, decree, etc., passed or made by Tribunal de Relacao. Any person aggrieved-
1576419 aby any judgment, decree, order or sentence of the Tribunal de Relacao passed or made before the 20th December, 1961, against which an appeal would lie to a superior court in Portugal in accordance with law but could not be preferred by reason of Goa, Daman and Diu becoming part of the territory of India, or against which an appeal having been preferred to a superior court in Portugal in accordance with law had not been disposed of before the said date; or
1100119 bby any judgment, decree, order or sentence of the Tribunal de Relacao passed or made on or after the 20th December, 1961, may, within ninety days from the date of passing of this Act, prefer an appeal from such judgment, decree, order or sentence to the Supreme Court as if such judgment, decree, order or sentence had been passed or made by the Judicial Commissioner' s Court.
1461430 8Repeal of section 7 of Act 1 of 1962. Section 7 of the Goa, Daman and Diu (Administration) Act, 1962 is hereby repealed.
